intro: Heppiella, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy and have a distinctive, rough texture. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish or reddish in color. Heppiella species are generally herbaceous, with some species growing as annuals or perennials depending on the climate.
